page.title: 16NATURAL HISTORY (PART 1)
page.content: The bird population of the area is broadly typical of open arable country with many copses,hedgerows,small rivers and streams.In the open country are finches,buntings,thrushes,sparrows ,crows,woodpigeon,lapwing,skylark,and starling.In copses live game birds: pheasant,partridge,titmice,woodpeckers ,tree creepers,wren,goldcrest and dunnock.The moorhen,kingfisher, heron, mallard and snipe live on the riverside. Uncommon birds in the area are,three kinds of owls;tawny,little and the barn owl;kestrel and the sparrowhawks.The summer migrants are swallows,martins,swifts,warblers,cukoo ,flycatchers,and winter migrants are the fieldfare and redwing. Mammals found in this area are both fallow and roe deer,the rabbit,hare, squirrel and hedgehog,and the smaller ones,rats,mice,shrews,voles and bats.
